DOC.brief_summary: The aim of the project is to assess whether the continuous visualization of on-line teacher in virtual reality (VR) is effective for the improvement of upper limb motor function, in stroke patients.
DOC.brief_title: Comparison Study of 'Virtual Teacher' Support for Rehabilitation After Stroke.
DOC.detailed_description: A single-blind randomized controlled trial (RCT) will be carried out to compare the effects of reinforced feedback in virtual environment (RFVE) treatment with continuous displaying of a virtual teacher (EVER TEACHER group) with RFVE without the presence of a virtual teacher (NEVER TEACHER group).
DOC.criteria: first single stroke at last 24 months before the enrolment, absence of ideomotor apraxia, neglect, aphasia interfering with verbal comprehension, Functional Independence Measure (FIM) less than 100 points out of 126 FuglMeyer upper extremity (FM UE) scale score (between 10 and 55). fracture, major depressive disorders, other acquired brain injuries, epilepsy.
